extractions.description: The paper proposes Geom3D, a benchmark for symmetry-informed geometric representation learning methods. Geom3D benchmarks the effectiveness of geometric strategies using 16 models and 14 pretraining methods on 46 datasets, covering small molecules, proteins, and crystalline materials.

title.value: Symmetry-Informed Geometric Representation for Molecules, Proteins, and Crystalline Materials
title.justification: Found in the title section of the paper.
title.quote: Symmetry-Informed Geometric Representation for Molecules, Proteins, and Crystalline Materials

type.justification: The paper benchmarks various models and methods across several datasets, providing empirical results.
type.quote: Geom3D contains 16 advanced symmetry-informed geometric representation models and 14 geometric pretraining methods over 46 diverse datasets

research_field.justification: The paper deals with deep learning approaches for geometric representation learning.
research_field.quote: Artificial intelligence for scientific discovery has recently generated significant interest within the machine learning and scientific communities

sub_research_field.justification: Focused on 3D geometric representation learning using symmetry-informed methods.
sub_research_field.quote: the effectiveness of geometric strategies using 16 models and 14 pretraining methods on 46 datasets, covering small molecules, proteins, and crystalline materials.

name.quote: invariant modeling. Specifically, several works have been adopting the invariant features for modeling, including but not limited to pairwise distance (SchNet [106]), bond angles (DimeNet [66]), and torsion angles (SphereNet [86] and GemNet [65]).

name.quote: Geom3D, a geometric modeling framework based on PyTorch Geometric (PyG) [30], one of the most widely-used platforms for graph representation learning.
